For example, all sentient beings in the realm of form have mind and so on continue in a series supported by form.
What supports the mind and so on of sentient beings born in the formless realm?

That is, if a cause that has not yet eliminated craving for form gives rise to mind, etc., the mind, etc., that is attracted is born together with form and evolves in dependence on form.

Why are they called the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness?

The realm belonging to the formless is called the formless realm. The middle word is omitted, as explained before.
Moreover, the realm of desire is called the desire realm because this realm has the power to support desire.
The form realm and formless realm should be understood in the same way.
What dharmas are referred to here by the word desire?
In brief, it refers to coarse food and the craving induced by sexual desire.

The present statement is not the same as those answers. It means that for those who have not yet abandoned craving for the various realms in the desire realm, craving is called craving for desire. That which increases along with it is called bound to the desire realm.

What are the five destinies?
Verse:

Treatise:
In the three realms, it is said that there are five destinies, which are the hells, animals, hungry ghosts, humans, and gods, as explained by their own names. This is called the five destinies.
Only the desire realm has all four destinies, and each of the three realms has a part of the heavenly destiny.
Are there any realms that are not included in the destinies, yet which are said to exist within the realms?

The substance of the five destinies is only non-defiled and indeterminate. If it were otherwise, the destinies would be mixed, because in each destiny there would be the karma and passions of the five destinies.
